intro: Dialium occidentale subsp. septentrionale, commonly known as the African apple or matoke, is a tropical tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are widely consumed, and its seeds are also used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid climates and is often found in forested areas. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different morphology compared to other Dialium species.
